intro: Lennea salvadorensis, commonly known as the Salvadoran lennea, is a shrub native to El Salvador. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
